column4: Sadly, the computer's original Os is failing ( windows ) and I need it to act as a live CD
I have the ubuntu 8.10 desktop i386, I think that's the one with the most configurations; I'm not savvy with linux based OSs at all so forgive me for being a noob in this case
I don't use burning programs, I use the built-in functionality of Windows
Surlent77 : Windows can burn CDs ... I'm not sure if the flag for a bootable CD is set by a program or by the contents of the CD though
Ah, I use MagicISo for extraction
you shouldn't have to extract anything, the livecd's are downloaded in an image format, .iso. Go here: http://www.imgburn.com/index.php?act=download
well yeah, I downloaded the .iso for ubuntu 8.10 , extracted the files using MagicISo, burned the extracted files to a CD but the CD isn't bootable
yea, that's why, you need to burn the image, not extract the files out, that's why you're having issues
